comments:
repro:
1) create a JUnit test suite
2) in the test suite editor that opened, add a couple test cases.
3) add a invocations or loop on the test cases.
4) save the test suite.
5) delete a test case that has an invocation.
6) save the test suite.
An error dialog pop up. The test suite resource seems to be corrupted from here 
on.
Here is the log:

First, this happens in some other cases: with the URL testing example, after 
removing test cases in the test navigator and after deleting the last test 
case.

The problem is that the 
org.eclipse.hyades.test.ui.RemoveChildrenAction.breakFeatures
(IStructuredSelection ) method does not check all the emf objects that have 
the candidate (ie the test case to be removed) in their contents.
The problem comes from the 
org.eclipse.hyades.models.hierarchy.util.ContainmentTraverser class that does 
not visit all the elements. The visit is stopped after the discover of the 
first candidate.
Then some emf objects still have reference to the candidate to the deletion.
The exception is then thrown.

The correction should be to complete the visit of the ContainmentTraverser but 
we need to fully investigate this fix.
*** Bug 75686 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
*** Bug 73062 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

I was unable to contain this in 3.2 i2.  I'm working on a fix now, but it will
go into 3.3
*** Bug 83092 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

Now that we have a "3.3" Version in bugzilla, updating bugzillas targeted to 3.3
or a 3.3 iteration so that their Version matches their Target. "future",
"unspecified", "4.0", and "4.1" Versions will not be updated.
